text: Gov. Chris Sununu: This Is How to Beat Trump  —  This week, Republican primary candidates for president will have a chance to make their case before a national audience — with or without Donald Trump on the debate stage.  To win, they must break free of Mr. Trump's drama, step out of his shadow …

Iowa Poll: Donald Trump holds commanding lead in first test of 2024 Republican caucus field  —  Donald Trump's lead among likely Republican caucusgoers grew 5 points after his indictment in Georgia, according to the new Des Moines Register/NBC News/Mediacom Iowa Poll  —  Brianne Pfannenstiel Michaela RammDes Moines Register

Meet the Press - August 20, 2023  —  CHUCK TODD:  —  This Sunday, defending Trump.  The Republican presidential hopefuls are getting ready to take to the debate stage for the first time, as Donald Trump prepares to be arrested for the fourth time.  —  FMR. PRES. DONALD TRUMP:  —  It's a witch hunt.

Biden administration to urge Americans get new COVID-19 boosters  —  The Biden administration plans to urge all Americans to get a booster shot for the coronavirus this autumn to counter a new wave of infections, a White House official said on Sunday.  —  The official said that while the Centers …

New district lines will scramble key New York House races  —  The interminable legal fight over redistricting in New York will likely leave both parties unclear which races will be competitive until sometime next spring.  —  ALBANY, N.Y. — Candidates are eager to run in competitive House seats in New York next year.

Vivek Ramaswamy's Truth  —  The Millennial outsider Republican says he wants a revolution.  To get there, he'd gut the federal government.  —  vivek ramaswamy leaned forward in his leather seat aboard the Cessna 750.  He was fiddling with his pen, talking about Donald Trump.  It was the final Friday in July.

How conservatives use ‘verbal jiu-jitsu’ to turn liberals' language against them  —  The two frontrunners for the White House in 2024 are tied in a hypothetical rematch.  Congress is paralyzed.  Every big election seems to be decided by razor-thin margins.
